questions.question: What is rhinoplasty?
questions.answer: Rhinoplasty is a surgical procedure that reshapes or repairs the nose. It can be performed for cosmetic purposes to improve the appearance of the nose or for functional purposes to correct breathing problems.

questions.question: Am I a good candidate for rhinoplasty?
questions.answer: Good candidates for rhinoplasty are individuals who are in good overall health, have realistic expectations about the outcomes, and are seeking improvement in the appearance or function of their nose. A consultation with Dr. Kalkavan will help determine if you are a suitable candidate.

questions.question: How long does the rhinoplasty surgery take?
questions.answer: Rhinoplasty surgery typically takes between 1.5 to 3 hours, depending on the complexity of the procedure and the techniques used.

questions.question: How long is the recovery period?
questions.answer: Initial recovery takes about 1-2 weeks, during which you may experience swelling and bruising. Most patients can return to work after 7-10 days. Full results are visible after 6-12 months as the swelling completely subsides.

questions.question: Will I have visible scars after surgery?
questions.answer: With closed rhinoplasty, all incisions are made inside the nose, leaving no visible scars. Open rhinoplasty involves a small incision on the columella, which typically heals to become nearly invisible.

questions.question: How many rhinoplasty surgeries has Dr. Can Kalkavan performed?
questions.answer: Dr. Can Kalkavan has performed over 20,000 successful rhinoplasty procedures with a 98% patient satisfaction rate.

testimonials.description: We love our patients, but don't just take our word for it. Take a look at what they say about us!

reviews.text: I had my nose surgery with Op. Dr. Can Kalkavan and I am more than satisfied with the result. Thanks to his knowledge, attentive care, and reassuring approach before and after the surgery, I felt safe and confident at every step. He carefully listened to my wishes, patiently answered all my questions, and achieved a natural and perfectly fitting result for my face.
reviews.name: Anna Müller

reviews.text: I had my rhinoplasty done with Op. Dr. Can Kalkavan in early November 2024, and I couldn't be happier with my choice. This was my first-ever surgery, and I was extremely nervous, but both Dr. Kalkavan and his team made the entire process so smooth and reassuring. Their kindness, professionalism, and attentiveness were outstanding from start to finish.
reviews.name: Hannah Schmidt

reviews.text: I recently had a rhinoplasty surgery, and I couldn't be happier with the results. Op. Dr. Can Kalkavan is a true artist and an extremely caring individual. From the moment I walked into his office, I knew I was in good hands. The doctor and his staff were incredibly professional and friendly, making me feel comfortable and at ease throughout the entire process.
reviews.name: Emily Thompson

whyTurkey.title: Why Choose Turkey for Your Rhinoplasty?

reasons.title: Affordable Prices:
reasons.description: Turkey offers rhinoplasty at more competitive prices than many European countries, while maintaining high standards of medical care.

reasons.title: Geographic Advantage:
reasons.description: With Istanbul as a global hub, patients can combine surgery with cultural experiences, making the journey both medical and touristic.

reasons.title: Advanced Techniques:
reasons.description: Turkish surgeons are skilled in open, closed, and push-down & let-down rhinoplasty, achieving natural and functional results

reasons.title: Cutting-Edge Technology:
reasons.description: Hospitals use 3D imaging, modern surgical tools, and innovative recovery methods, ensuring safe operations and faster healing.

cookieConsent.title: Manage Consent
cookieConsent.description: To provide the best experiences, we use technologies like cookies to store and/or access device information. Consenting to these technologies will allow us to process data such as browsing behavior or unique IDs on this site. Not consenting or withdrawing consent, may adversely affect certain features and functions.
